name: Virtual Cell
description: VCell (Virtual Cell) is a comprehensive platform for modeling cell biological systems that is built on a central database and disseminated as a standalone application

references.title: A general computational framework for modeling cellular structure and function
references.authors: J Schaff, CC Fink, B Slepchenko, JH Carson, LM Leow

references.title: The Virtual Cell: A Software Environment for Computational Cell Biology
Spatial Modeling of Cell Signaling Networks
references.authors: Ann E. Cowan, Ion I. Moraru, James C. Scaff, Boris M. Slepchenko, Leslie M. Loew

references.title: The Virtual Cell Modeling and Simulation Software Environment
references.authors: Ion I. Moraru, James C. Scaff, Boris M. Slepchenko, Micheal Blinov, Frank Morgan, Anuradha Lakshminaryana, Fei Gao, Ye Li, Leslie M. Loew

references.title: Compartmental and Spatial Rule-Based Modeling with Virtual Cell
references.authors: Micheal L. Blinov, James C. Scaff, Dan Vasilescu, Ion I. Moraru, Judy E. Bloom, Leslie M. Loew

algorithms.name: C-language Variable-coefficient Ordinary Differential Equation solver

kisaoTerm.name: CVODE
kisaoTerm.description: The CVODE is a package written in C that solves ODE initial value problems, in real N-space, written as y'=f(t,y), y(t0)=y0. It is capable for stiff and non-stiff systems and uses two different linear multi-step methods, namely the Adam-Moulton [http://identifiers.org/biomodels.kisao/KISAO_0000280] method and the backward differentiation formula [http://identifiers.org/biomodels.kisao/KISAO_0000288].

ontologyTerms.name: CVODE-like method
ontologyTerms.description: Solves ODE initial value problems, in real N-space, written as y'=f(t,y), y(t0)=y0. It is capable for stiff and non-stiff systems and uses two different linear multi-step methods, namely the Adam-Moulton [http://identifiers.org/biomodels.kisao/KISAO_0000280] method and the backward differentiation formula [http://identifiers.org/biomodels.kisao/KISAO_0000288].

modelingFrameworks.name: non-spatial continuous framework
modelingFrameworks.description: Modelling approach where the quantities of participants are considered continuous, and represented by real values. The associated simulation methods make use of differential equations. The models do not take into account the distribution of the entities and describe only the temporal fluxes.

references.title: CVODE, a stiff/nonstiff ODE solver in C
references.authors: Scott D Cohen, Alan C Hindmarsh & and Paul F Dubois

kisaoTerm.name: relative tolerance
kisaoTerm.description: This parameter is a numeric value specifying the desired relative tolerance the user wants to achieve. A smaller value means that the trajectory is calculated more accurately.

kisaoTerm.name: Runge-Kutta based method
kisaoTerm.description: The Runge Kutta methods provide further systematic improvement in the spirit of the modified Euler method. Second order fixed time step method is also called the midpoint method.

ontologyTerms.name: Runge-Kutta based method
ontologyTerms.description: A method of numerically integrating ordinary differential equations, which uses a sampling of slopes through an interval and takes a weighted average to determine the right end point. This averaging gives a very accurate approximation.

modelingFrameworks.name: non-spatial continuous framework
modelingFrameworks.description: Modelling approach where the quantities of participants are considered continuous, and represented by real values. The associated simulation methods make use of differential equations. The models do not take into account the distribution of the entities and describe only the temporal fluxes.
